chinese: 1) happening over a long period and involving a lot of difficulties 漫长而艰难的
examples: e.g. Three generations of fishermen are engaged in an [[epic]] struggle against nature, fate, and society in this moving tale.；e.g. This island is a place of great adventures and [[epic]] tales, inhabited by five tribes.

chinese: 2) telling a long story about brave actions and exciting events 英雄的；英勇的；史诗般的
examples: e.g. Three generations of fishermen are engaged in an [[epic]] struggle against nature, fate, and society in this moving tale.；e.g. This island is a place of great adventures and [[epic]] tales, inhabited by five tribes.

chinese: having a rough or pointed edge or surface 凹凸不平的；锯齿状的
examples: e.g. For centuries, the Rocky Mountains have captivated visitors with their [[jagged]] peaks, magnificent waterfalls, and blue lakes.

chinese: [C, U] smoke, dust, or mist in the air which is difficult to see through 烟雾；霾
examples: e.g. Just as the Sun began to break through an early-morning [[haze]], I spotted three horses on a hill.

chinese: give sth. a small amount of a particular color, emotion, or quality 着淡色于···；使带有一点（情绪、特质等）
examples: e.g. The light of the setting sun [[tinges]] the buildings with delicate colors.

chinese: 1) [C] a particular type of red, green, blue, etc. （色彩的）浓淡，深浅，色度
examples: e.g. The bright yellow [[shade]] is meant to evoke the optimistic promise of a sunshine-filled day.；e.g. I spent most of the day walking on the shore or reading a novel in the [[shade]] of a large beach umbrella.

chinese: 2) [U] slight darkness or shelter from the direct light of the Sun made by sth. blocking it 背阴处；阴凉处
examples: e.g. The bright yellow [[shade]] is meant to evoke the optimistic promise of a sunshine-filled day.；e.g. I spent most of the day walking on the shore or reading a novel in the [[shade]] of a large beach umbrella.

chinese: (of a feeling, belief, etc.) lasting for a long time and not changing （感情或信念等）长久的，持久的
examples: e.g. My [[abiding]] memory is of him watering his plants in the garden on sunny afternoons.

chinese: [C] sb. who knows a lot about a particular subject, esp. one that is not a science subject （尤指精于一门文科学问的）学者
examples: e.g. He is internationally recognized as a distinguished [[scholar]] in the field of Chinese studies.

chinese: [C] sb. who takes complete control of a country or its people 征服者
examples: e.g. Local people have to obey their [[conquerors]] because they want to go on living.

chinese: make a sudden sideways movement while moving forward, usu. in order to avoid hitting sth. （通常为了避免碰撞）突然转向一边
examples: e.g. The vehicle [[swerved]] off the road, hit a lamppost and rolled several times before catching fire.

chinese: move forward or backward while also quickly moving slightly from side to side 一摇一摆地走（移动）
examples: e.g. The performer shook, jumped and [[shimmied]] in perfect motion, spurring the crowd to rise in an emotional applause.

chinese: move slowly along on wheels, or make sth. do this by pushing or pulling it （使）缓慢移动（滚动）
examples: e.g. Hundreds of trucks full of fruit and vegetables [[trundled]] across the border each day.

chinese: 1) （尤指穿越沙漠地带的）旅行队，商队
2) （AmE trailer）（带有食宿设备的）旅行拖车
[C, U] 香料
1) (written) knock sb. down with great force （用力）击倒（某人）
examples: e.g. A 25-year-old man was [[felled]] by that boxer with a single punch.；e.g. Fifteen million trees were [[felled]] by the Great Storm which hit the south of England in 1987.

chinese: 2) cut down a tree 砍伐（树木）
examples: e.g. A 25-year-old man was [[felled]] by that boxer with a single punch.；e.g. Fifteen million trees were [[felled]] by the Great Storm which hit the south of England in 1987.

chinese: 1) [C, usu. pl.] (lit. or fml.) a danger or problem in a particular activity or situation （某活动或情况的）危险，凶险
examples: e.g. These birds are able to survive the [[perils]] of the Arctic winter.；e.g. This was the second time that he had put his life in [[peril]] to rescue someone at risk of drowning.

chinese: 2) [U] (lit. or fml.) great danger, esp. of being harmed or killed 巨大的危险（尤指受损或被杀）
examples: e.g. These birds are able to survive the [[perils]] of the Arctic winter.；e.g. This was the second time that he had put his life in [[peril]] to rescue someone at risk of drowning.

chinese: relating to the weather in a particular area 气候的
examples: e.g. It should be noted that some parts of the world seem to be experiencing [[climatic]] changes.

chinese: (fml.) move across, over, or through sth., esp. an area of land or water 跨过；穿过；横越；横穿
examples: e.g. They crossed the bridge and [[traversed]] the road out into the open country.

chinese: 1) belonging to an enemy 敌人的；敌方的
examples: e.g. They warned us that the northern half of the island was controlled by [[hostile]] forces.；e.g. Rebecca was very [[hostile]] toward us and made it clear she didn't want our help.

chinese: 2) angry and deliberately unfriendly toward sb. and ready to argue with them 怀有敌意的；敌对的；不好的
examples: e.g. They warned us that the northern half of the island was controlled by [[hostile]] forces.；e.g. Rebecca was very [[hostile]] toward us and made it clear she didn't want our help.

chinese: [C, U] land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force 领土；版图；领地
examples: e.g. The new oil contracts will amount to a half billion dollars' worth of foreign investment in their [[territory]].

chinese: continue to do sth., although this is difficult, or other people oppose it 坚持；执意
examples: e.g. He urged the United States to [[persist]] with its efforts to bring about peace.

chinese: [sing.] the feeling of wanting or needing a drink 渴；口渴
examples: e.g. After walking five miles, they had worked up a great [[thirst]] and decided to stop for water.

chinese: [C, U] a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave 思想（体系）；思想意识
examples: e.g. To put it another way, the analysis lacks both a sense of humanism and a theory of [[ideology]].

chinese: [U, sing.] a mysterious, exciting, or desirable quality 诱惑；魅力；吸引力
examples: e.g. There will always be "lost in translation" moments, but that's part of the [[allure]] of foreign travel.

chinese: being part of the nature or character of sb. / sth. 本质的；内在的；固有的
examples: e.g. The [[intrinsic]] value of a coin is the value of the metal it is made of.

chinese: 1) [U] the feeling of excitement and adventure that is related to a particular place, activity, etc. 传奇色彩；浪漫情调
examples: e.g. There are plenty of ways to see the country this summer, but few can beat the [[romance]] of traveling on a steam train.；e.g. Hemingway's [[romance]] with his nurse inspired him to write A Farewell to Arms.

chinese: 2) [C] an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other 罗曼史；风流韵事
examples: e.g. There are plenty of ways to see the country this summer, but few can beat the [[romance]] of traveling on a steam train.；e.g. Hemingway's [[romance]] with his nurse inspired him to write A Farewell to Arms.

chinese: 1) believe that sth. sb. does or sth. that happens has a particular meaning 把···理解（解释）为
examples: e.g. His refusal to work late was [[interpreted]] as a lack of commitment to the company.；e.g. She couldn't speak much English so her children had to [[interpret]] for her while traveling in the UK.

chinese: 2) translate spoken words from one language into another 口译
examples: e.g. His refusal to work late was [[interpreted]] as a lack of commitment to the company.；e.g. She couldn't speak much English so her children had to [[interpret]] for her while traveling in the UK.

chinese: 1) continuing for a long time 持久的
examples: e.g. The feelings that arise in that condition are simpler, more understandable, and more [[durable]].；e.g. Fine bone china is very practical due to the fact that it is strong and [[durable]].

chinese: 2) staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot 耐用的
examples: e.g. The feelings that arise in that condition are simpler, more understandable, and more [[durable]].；e.g. Fine bone china is very practical due to the fact that it is strong and [[durable]].

chinese: [C] (fml.) (be a ~ to sth.) prove or show very clearly that sth. exists or is true 是···的证据；是···的证明
examples: e.g. The new model is a [[testament]] to the skill and dedication of the workforce.

chinese: 1) make sb. feel strong admiration 使···倾倒
examples: e.g. As children, we were [[dazzled]] by my uncle's good looks and charm.；e.g. Drivers are supposed to slow down or pull over when they are [[dazzled]] by bright sunlight.

chinese: 2) makes sb. unable to see properly for a short time （因强光、闪烁等）使···目眩；使···眼花缭乱
examples: e.g. As children, we were [[dazzled]] by my uncle's good looks and charm.；e.g. Drivers are supposed to slow down or pull over when they are [[dazzled]] by bright sunlight.

chinese: 1) repeat exactly the same journey that sb. else has made 重走（别人走过的路程）
examples: e.g. They are hoping to [[retrace]] the [[epic]] voyage of Christopher Columbus.；e.g. By trailing a thread behind them spiders are able to drop from any height to the ground and to [[retrace]] their steps with certainty to a particular spot.

chinese: 2) go back exactly the way you have come 顺原路返回；折返
examples: e.g. They are hoping to [[retrace]] the [[epic]] voyage of Christopher Columbus.；e.g. By trailing a thread behind them spiders are able to drop from any height to the ground and to [[retrace]] their steps with certainty to a particular spot.

chinese: a.relating or referring to Buddhism 佛教的
examples: e.g. Lingyin Temple is a famous [[Buddhist]] temple situated in the northwest of Hangzhou.

chinese: n.[C] sb. who believes in Buddhism 佛教徒
examples: e.g. Lingyin Temple is a famous [[Buddhist]] temple situated in the northwest of Hangzhou.

chinese: [C] (pl. grottos or grottoes) a small attractive cave 小洞穴
examples: e.g. This [[grotto]] houses the most exquisite stone sculptures from the Tang Dynasty.

chinese: 1) move or go somewhere slowly 缓缓移动；缓慢行走
examples: e.g. The crowd [[drifted]] away from the scene of the accident.；e.g. As our boat [[drifted]] down the river, many children ran along the shore waving at us.

chinese: 2) move slowly on water or in the air 漂流；漂移
examples: e.g. The crowd [[drifted]] away from the scene of the accident.；e.g. As our boat [[drifted]] down the river, many children ran along the shore waving at us.

chinese: surrounded by beautiful views of nature 景色优美的
examples: e.g. Yosemite National Park is an area of outstanding [[scenic]] beauty and great wilderness value.

chinese: 1) [C, U] rock or cloud that is formed in a particular shape, or the shape in which it is formed （岩石或云朵的）形成物；形状
examples: e.g. Enormous cloud [[formations]] dominate the landscape on a hot, humid summer's day.；e.g. An agreement on the [[formation]] of a new government was reached on June 6.

chinese: 2) [U] the process of starting a new organization or group 构成；组成
examples: e.g. Enormous cloud [[formations]] dominate the landscape on a hot, humid summer's day.；e.g. An agreement on the [[formation]] of a new government was reached on June 6.

chinese: [C] (pl. oases) （沙漠中的）绿洲
[C] （海边或沙漠中的）沙丘
[C] a long narrow raised part of a surface, esp. a high edge along a mountain 山脊
[C] (AmE) （超级）高速公路
vi.spread out or cover a large area of land 延伸；绵延
examples: e.g. The beach [[stretches]] for more than two miles, backed by grassy dunes and sweet-smelling pine forest.

chinese: push or throw sth. very hard so that it moves through the air very quickly 把···弹（射）出去
examples: e.g. A loose dog is at the risk of falling or being [[catapulted]] out of the truck bed.

chinese: [U] a feeling of great respect and liking for sb. / sth. 崇敬；赞叹
examples: e.g. You might gaze at the Grand Canyon with [[awe]], marveling at its beauty and fearing its depth.

chinese: 1) [C] an event or situation that makes you feel great sadness 令人悲伤的事；不幸
examples: e.g. We cannot cure the world of [[sorrows]], but we can choose to live in joy.；e.g. The president expressed his deep [[sorrow]] over the bombing deaths.

chinese: 2) [U] a feeling of great sadness, usu. because sth. very bad has happened 悲伤；悲痛
examples: e.g. We cannot cure the world of [[sorrows]], but we can choose to live in joy.；e.g. The president expressed his deep [[sorrow]] over the bombing deaths.

chinese: involving risk or danger, esp. to sb's health or safety 危险的；有害的
examples: e.g. The report calls for a ban on the import of [[hazardous]] waste.

chinese: exposed, empty, or with no pleasant features 无遮掩的；荒凉的；索然无味的
examples: e.g. That's probably the most bare, [[bleak]], and inhospitable island I've ever seen.

chinese: very impressive or powerful, and often frightening 令人敬畏的；可怕的
examples: e.g. They had to overcome [[formidable]] obstacles during their journey.

chinese: 1) (of weather or living conditions) very difficult and unpleasant to live in 恶劣的；艰苦的；严峻的
examples: e.g. Penguins employ cooperative behaviors in order to deal with an incredibly [[harsh]] environment.；e.g. The solar cooker looks impressive, with mirrors designed to catch the [[harsh]] sunlight, focusing their power to create intense heat.

chinese: 2) unpleasantly bright 刺眼的；耀眼的
examples: e.g. Penguins employ cooperative behaviors in order to deal with an incredibly [[harsh]] environment.；e.g. The solar cooker looks impressive, with mirrors designed to catch the [[harsh]] sunlight, focusing their power to create intense heat.

chinese: [U] the state of suffering and death caused by having no food 饥饿；挨饿；饿死
examples: e.g. Millions of people in that region are threatened with [[starvation]] as a result of drought and poor harvests.

chinese: [C, U] (BrE civilisation) a society that is well organized and developed, used esp. about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time 文明（社会）
examples: e.g. The ancient [[civilizations]] of Central and Latin America were founded upon corn.

chinese: (fml.) happen before sth. or come before sb. / sth. in order 先于···（发生或出现）
examples: e.g. It would be helpful if you were to [[precede]] the report with an introduction.

chinese: [U] the ability to continue doing sth. difficult or painful over a long period of time （忍）耐力
examples: e.g. Running a marathon is seen by many people as the ultimate test of human [[endurance]].

english: trick sb. into sth. / doing sth.
chinese: cause sb. to do sth. by means of a trick 用计诱使某人做某事
examples: e.g. Dean [[tricked]] the old lady into giving him 800 pounds, claiming that he would invest it for her.

chinese: begin a journey by boat or ship 起航
examples: e.g. When Captain Cook [[set]] [[sail]] for the Pacific, he was heading to parts of the world that were little-known.

english: during / in / throughout / over the course of sth.
chinese: during sth. 在···期间
examples: e.g. We struck up a conversation, in the [[course]] of which it emerged that he was a sailing man.

chinese: have to deal with a problem or difficult situation （不得不）处理问题，对付困境
examples: e.g. The rescue team also had bad weather conditions to [[contend]] with.

chinese: 马可 • 波罗 （意大利旅行家）
公元
君士坦丁堡（伊斯坦布尔的旧称）
